benchmark_details.name: CityBench
benchmark_details.overview: CityBench is a comprehensive evaluation benchmark for assessing the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) and vision-language models (VLMs) on diverse urban tasks through multi-modal data and interactive simulations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of CityBench is to systematically evaluate the capabilities of LLMs and VLMs for various urban tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current data quality varies, which may affect evaluation results.

data.source: CityData collected from multiple urban data sources, including OpenStreetMap and Google Maps.
data.annotation: Manually curated and automatically generated annotations through LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions made by models in various urban tasks against ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Results are evaluated based on the ability of LLMs and VLMs to understand and process urban scenarios.
methodology.baseline_results: Model performance across various urban tasks reported in comparisons with traditional methods.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation methods using datasets from 13 cities to ensure representative performance.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Performance varies significantly across different geographical areas, indicating potential bias.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is anonymized to protect individual privacy.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data usage follows standard open data licenses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data collection adhered to ethical standards with respect to consent.
